column11:
This table provides the Spring 2016 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It records undergraduate and graduate instructional loads, applies graduate “extra credit,” and converts totals into FTE enrollments.

By School (Spring 2016):

Arts & Sciences – the largest contributor, with 56,977 total credit hours, equal to 3,834 FTEs.

Business – produced 15,077 credit hours for 1,021 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies – generated 16,402 credit hours, translating to 1,202 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – contributed 40,091 credit hours, supporting 2,730 FTEs.

No School – a very small category, with 409 credit hours and 28 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – teaching activity at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – added weighting for graduate courses.

Grand Total Credit Hours – combined instructional load after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized full-time enrollment equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
